subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Implementation for an already developed J2EE application
msgSnippet: ... In case that option is unavailable, try Cactus. It will help you write end-to-end tests for your system while you learn how to test each part in isolation
messageBody:
Praveen AH wrote:
> Hi Pramod,
>
> My suggestion is redevelopment of the application with the test driven
> development approach would be the best solution.

In case that option is unavailable, try Cactus. It will help you write
end-to-end tests for your system while you learn how to test each part
in isolation from the rest. _JUnit in Action_ provides some good
information on testing with Cactus, and Vince is a very good writer.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
